meanings.definition: People who do not participate in a game or activity.
meanings.sent1: During the soccer match, the nonplayers sat on the bench and cheered for their team.
meanings.sent2: The nonplayers watched from the sidelines as the basketball game unfolded.
meanings.sent3: The nonplayers decided to have a picnic instead of joining the volleyball game.
meanings.sent4: In the chess tournament of life, some people are content being nonplayers, observing the moves of others.
meanings.sent5: The group of nonplayers formed their own book club while the rest played tennis.

meanings.definition: Those who are not actively involved in a particular situation or event.
meanings.sent1: At the meeting, the nonplayers listened quietly without contributing to the discussion.
meanings.sent2: During the debate, the nonplayers remained silent and observed the arguments.
meanings.sent3: The nonplayers at the party enjoyed watching the karaoke performances instead of singing themselves.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the nonplayers were like shadows, unnoticed in the chaos of daily life.
meanings.sent5: The nonplayers in the office preferred to work quietly at their desks while others chatted.
